cscie55.hw3

Class Passenger

  • java.lang.Object
    • cscie55.hw3.Passenger
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable

    public class Passenger
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable
    This class represents a passenger located either inside the elevator or at any floor inside the multi-story building of the Elevator application.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int currentFloor
      Current floor where the passenger is standing.
      private int destinationFloor
      Destination of the passenger.
      private int elevatorToUse
      Indicates the elevator that the passenger decides to use.
      private java.util.Calendar queueArrivalTime
      Indicates the time on which the passenger arrives at the elevators whether for UP or DOWN service, for comparison purposes.
      private PassengerStatus status
      Enumeration type to determine the passenger's status at any given moment.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Passenger(int currentFloor)
      Creates a Passenger residing on current floor, not queued for boarding any elevator.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void arrive()
      Updates the passenger's status as it has arrived at its destination.
      int compareTo(java.lang.Object object)
      Compares this passenger with the specified object to order them by their respective queue arrival times.
      int getDestinationFloor()
      Returns the destination floor of the passenger object.
      int getElevatorToUse()
      Returns the elevator that the passenger is waiting to use.
      PassengerStatus getStatus()
      Gets the passenger's status.
      void queue(int destinationFloor, int elevatorToUse)
      Used when the passenger decides to use the elevators (either for up or down service), and receives a destination floor.
      void setStatus(PassengerStatus status)
      Modifies the passenger's status.

    • Field Detail

      • status

        private PassengerStatus status
        Enumeration type to determine the passenger's status at any given moment.
        status E {RESIDING, WAITING, ON_BOARD, DISPATCHED}
        See Also:
        PassengerStatus

      • currentFloor

        private int currentFloor
        Current floor where the passenger is standing.
        0 <= currentFloor < Elevator.NUMBER_OF_FLOORS

      • destinationFloor

        private int destinationFloor
        Destination of the passenger.
        0 <= destinationFloor < Elevator.NUMBER_OF_FLOORS

      • queueArrivalTime

        private java.util.Calendar queueArrivalTime
        Indicates the time on which the passenger arrives at the elevators whether for UP or DOWN service, for comparison purposes. Passengers will be loaded onto the elevators in the same order on which they arrive.

      • elevatorToUse

        private int elevatorToUse
        Indicates the elevator that the passenger decides to use. This is done to balance the load among the elevators. 0 <= elevatorToUse < Building.NUMBER_OF_ELEVATORS

    • Constructor Detail

      • Passenger

        public Passenger(int currentFloor)
        Creates a Passenger residing on current floor, not queued for boarding any elevator.
        Parameters:
        currentFloor - Floor where the passenger is standing, 0 <= currentFloor < Elevator.NUMBER_OF_FLOORS.

    • Method Detail

      • getStatus

        public PassengerStatus getStatus()
        Gets the passenger's status.
        Returns:
        PassengerStatus The current passenger's status.

      • setStatus

        public void setStatus(PassengerStatus status)
        Modifies the passenger's status.
        Parameters:
        status - The status to establish. status E {RESIDING, WAITING, ON_BOARD, DISPATCHED}

      • getDestinationFloor

        public int getDestinationFloor()
        Returns the destination floor of the passenger object.
        Returns:
        int The destination floor of the passenger.

      • getElevatorToUse

        public int getElevatorToUse()
        Returns the elevator that the passenger is waiting to use.
        Returns:
        Number of the elevator. 0 <= elevatorToUse < Building.NUMBER_OF_ELEVATORS

      • queue

        public void queue(int destinationFloor,
         int elevatorToUse)
        Used when the passenger decides to use the elevators (either for up or down service), and receives a destination floor.
        Parameters:
        destinationFloor - Floor where the passenger is heading.

      • arrive

        public void arrive()
        Updates the passenger's status as it has arrived at its destination.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(java.lang.Object object)
              throws java.lang.ClassCastException
        Compares this passenger with the specified object to order them by their respective queue arrival times. Returns a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as this object is less than, equal to, or greater than the specified object.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable
        Parameters:
        object - The passenger to compare to this passenger.
        Returns:
        Whether this passenger arrived at the queue before, after or at the time time than the other object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassCastException - If the given object is not an instance of Passenger.
